content: mini hot water bottle cover © kaylee rosenberger @kayleejorose 2025 size one size mini hot water bottle 350 ml capacity dimensions see schematic below a=3 5 inches b=4 5 inches c=4 5 inches yarn 35 g fingering weight yarn held double needles 3 5 mm needles 80 or 100 cm circulars for magic loop method can be adapted to work with dpns or small circulars gauge 24 st per 4 inches in stockinette this hot water bottle cover is knit top down from the cuff and seamed at the bottom using kitchener stitch it is a perfect gift knit as it works up in just a couple of hours and anyone would love a mini hot water bottle to carry around in winter it s great for stash busting and using up precious hand- dyed scraps since you only need 35g yarn any other yarn/needle combination can be used if it achieves gauge and the pattern is easily adaptable to meet other gauges in order for this pattern to fit well use the hot water bottle linked above or one with similar dimensions abbreviations st stitch ssk slip slip knit left leaning decrease k knit k2tog knit two together right leaning decrease p purl pattern cast on 52 st on 3 5 mm needles 80-100 cm cable using a long tail cast on divide the stitches equally between the two needles join the round and continue working in the round using the magic loop technique cuff knit in 1x1 ribbing k1 p1 to end of round repeat until the cuff measures 3 inches body knit stockinette in the round k to end of round repeat until the stockinette section measures 4 25 inches then work decrease rounds every other row twice 4 more row total decrease round *k1 ssk k to 3 st before end of needle k2tog k1* repeat * * for other needle finishing seam up the bottom of the cover using kitchener stitch wash and block your cover remove cover when microwaving or filling the bottle
